meanings.definition: To complain or protest about something in a bad-tempered way.
meanings.sent1: She would often grumble about having to do her chores.
meanings.sent2: The old man would grumble every time the weather turned cold.
meanings.sent3: Despite his grumble, he knew he had to finish his homework.
meanings.sent4: The engine started to grumble as it struggled up the hill.
meanings.sent5: The toddler's grumble could be heard throughout the house.

meanings.sent1: The distant grumble of thunder signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The grumble of the train could be felt through the tracks.
meanings.sent3: The stomach's grumble reminded him it was time for lunch.
meanings.sent4: The grumble of the waterfall echoed through the canyon.
meanings.sent5: The grumble of the earthquake shook the entire town.
